document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Luiz Fernando M. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Teudis tetrasetus
Mello-Leitão, 1939
: 92
, figs 85, 86 (male lectotype and immature paralectotype , designated by
Forcart 1961
: 64
, from Bemalcue, Paraguay , 1985 , Dr C. Terntz leg., deposited in MHNB , 1221 a, examined).
Xiruana tetraseta :
Brescovit, 1997
: 104
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Males of
X. tetraseta
resemble those of
X. silarae
n . sp .
by the palp with a digitiform projection at the base of the embolus, but differs by having the median tibial apophysis extremely long and by the smooth border of the conductor of Anyphaeninae (
Figs 5
A, D–F). The females resemble those of
X. pocone
n . sp .
by the shape of the epigynal plate, but differs by the very wide median septum, with the lateral ends of the anterior border projecting on the atrium and internally with a transversal, anterior sclerotized handle (
Figs 5
G, H).

Description . Male ( MHNB 1221 a). Coloration as in
X. hirsuta
. Total length 5.7 , carapace length 2.75 , width 2.05 . Clypeus height 0.07 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.16 , ALE 0.15 , PME 0.16 , PLE 0.15 ; AME– AME 0.05 , AME–ALE 0.05 , PME–PME 0.15 , PME–PLE 0.12 , ALE–PLE 0.03 . Chelicerae 1.2 long, with five promarginal teeth and six retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I —femur 2.55 / patella 1.15 / tibia 2.65 / metatarsus 2.4 / tarsus 1.2 / total 9.95 ; II— 2.30 / 1.05 / 2.0/ 1.85 / 0.85 / 8.05 ; III— 1.85 / 0.85 / 1.3 / 1.5 / 0.6 / 6.1 ; IV— 2.65 / 1.0/ 2.1 / 2.8 / 0.75 / 9.3 . Leg spination: I—tibia
v 2 - 1
- 1 , p 0-1 -0, r 0-1 -0, metatarsus
v 2 - 2
- 2 , p0, r0; II—tibia
v 2 - 1
- 1 , p0, r 0-1 -0, metatarsus
v 1-2
- 2 , p0; III—tibia
v 1-2
- 2 , metatarsus r 1 - 1 -0. Palp: retrolateral tibial apophysis with long, curved posterior branch of the retrolateral tibial apophysis and short, slender anterior branch of the prolateral tibial apophysis (
Figs 5
D–F); median apophysis not projected at base (
Figs 5
D–C). Abdomen: length 3.2 , epigastric furrow 0.4 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 1.5 from base of spinnerets.

Female ( IBSP 165975 ). Coloration as in male. Total length 7.5 , carapace length 3.1 , width 2.4 . Clypeus height 0.12 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.16 , ALE 0.14 , PME 0.14 , PLE 0.14 ; AME–AME 0.06 , AME–ALE 0.05 , PME–PME 0.22 , PME–PLE 0.1 , ALE–PLE 0.02 . Chelicerae 1.7 long, with four promarginal teeth and five retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I—femur 2.6 / patella 1.2 / tibia 2.4 / metatarsus 2.2 / tarsus 1.0/ total 9.4 ; II— 2.4 / 1.2 / 2.1 / 2.0/ 0.9 / 8.6 ; III— 1.8 / 0.9 / 1.48 / 1.5 / 0.6 / 6.28 ; IV— 2.9 / 1.1 / 2.4 / 3.0/ 0.8 / 10.2 . Leg spination: I—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; II—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; III—tibia
v 1-2
- 2 , p 0-1 - 1 , r 0-1 - 1 ; IV—tibia
v 1-2
- 2 , p 0-1 - 1 , r 0-1 - 1 . Abdomen: length 4.3 , epigastric furrow 0.7 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 2.3 from base of spinnerets. Epigynum: spermathecae oval, fertilization ducts long, two times the length of spermathecae, seminal receptacles with short ducts, in the middle of the copulatory ducts (
Figs 5
G, H).
Variation . Males (n = 8 ): total length 4.2 –8.0; carapace 1.9–2.9 ; femur I 2.0–3.0. Females (n = 10 ): total length 5.5–10.2 ; carapace 2.4–3.6 ; femur I 1.8 –3.0.

Other material examined . VENEZUELA , Bolívar : 35 km SW Puerto Ordaz (
8 °07’ 19 ”S
;

Distribution . Central Venezuela , Midwest and Southeast Brazil , Central and South Paraguay (
Fig. 15
B).
